bio.address: 10/16 Hanoar Haoved Street, Ashkelon, zip code 78751
bio.brief: in Ethiopia I was a teacher and an education inspector. Along with my government job I was a social leader and activist, in all life aspects. I worked with all different levels of society in 'Shire' at Tigray regional government. I hosted private people and groups, as well as social and international functions. In Israel i taught for the first two years, I counseled and guided droups about different topics such as relocation, education, health, culture, laws and rules of behavior. I still take part in social activities as long as it doesn't interfere with my work as social care department.
bio.languages: English, Hebrew, Tigrinya, Amharic, Russian (reading and writing)

B.A in social work, M.A in organizational counseling and development.

socialWork.desc: In the center for preventing and treatig family violence

publicActivity.desc: Director of a youth movement and some young people. Secretary for the teacher organization. Representative of community in city hall. Editor of the local newspaper. Host and guide of groups, meetings ' events and both national and international ceremonies

Was chosen as a member of a national committee in the topic of education and culture for the Ethiopian people. Also worked as a substitute for the chairman of the Ethiopian community association in Ashkelon. Worked as a member of the Ethiopian Jewish Center, was a member of the students leadership. For several years I was a volunteer in the Ashkelon Police. I participate in the forum of Ethiopian social workers. A member of Tabaka a legal ait center and a community defender for Ethiopians
